comments.text:
Manning is an Idiot. He apparently knows nothing about world history, 
ethnicity nor world religions. It doesn't take a genius to do two minutes 
of research and find the meaning of 'Young Turks' or even to find 
information about the show. Manning's blabbering about Cenk's 
race/ethnicity was an embarrassment to all black people. Dreadlocks are a 
sign that someone is a violent thug. Really? Anyone who has any religious 
education at all should know that the core beliefs of the Rastafarian faith 
are actually based on peace and that dreads are a covenant with god to show 
a true believer. Lastly-  Ana does have nice boobs,no argument there. But 
to say she has no other input to the show....wow.﻿

comments.text:
Dear Pastor: We are still "debating" EQUALITY? Equal treatment under the 
law. Same rights and responsibilities. if YOU want LESS, accept less. 
Everyone else will be entitled to EQUALITY. Don't wanna get married? Then 
don't! Want to marry someone you are not compatible with? Go ahead. It's 
YOUR choice. If you enjoy being demeaned and discriminated against, fine. 
NOBODY wants to be mistreated or disadvantaged, but BIGOTS want such 
needless pain and suffering for OTHERS. You are going against the Golden 
Rule, against the Bible and against the Constitution! Stop projecting your 
profoundly flawed character...bigotry is NOT a virtue!﻿

You're not a critic.

You just have internet access. 
Once you recognize your insignificance in the greater scheme of things, 
perhaps you can stop insisting that you feel, think and speak for 
everybody, because you certainly don't. You are one tiny part of an 
ever-shrinking minority of very vocal morons who are tolerated, but not 
taken seriously. You are advertising your profound ignorance, while 
proclaiming to be whatever your deluded mind tells you you are. Life's too 
short to keep "debating" people devoid of any redeeming values, without any 
care for the improvement of society or solving its problems. Time to move 
on without coddling the agents provocateur. Sometimes the best thing to do 
when encountering ignorance is to ignore it. Eventually it (ignorance) will 
tire out and go away. We live in hope.﻿
